meanings.definition: An imaginary monster used to frighten children.
meanings.sent1: The boogieman in the story was just a made-up creature.
meanings.sent2: Every child knows about the boogieman under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the thought of the boogieman hiding in the closet.
meanings.sent4: The idea of the boogieman coming to get you is like a dark shadow in your mind.
meanings.sent5: The illustrator drew the boogieman with sharp teeth and glowing eyes to make it more scary.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is widely feared.
meanings.sent1: The politician was seen as a boogieman by his opponents.
meanings.sent2: The boogieman of the town was the mysterious old man who lived in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The idea of failure was the boogieman that haunted his dreams.
meanings.sent4: The boogieman of self-doubt whispered in her ear, making her question every decision.
meanings.sent5: The boogieman of uncertainty loomed over the project, causing anxiety among the team.
